page.title: 07FARMING Pentney & Narboro'
page.content:
The farming in this area is mostly arable, i.e. Barley, Wheat, Sugar beet and potatoes.{The villages of Pentney {and Narborough stand side by side, {but the land is worked in completely {different ways.}The land in Pentney is divided into small family owned farms, only using outside labour on a casual basis. As well as arable farming sheep and cattle are fattened on small areas of pasture set aside for this.
The majority of land at Narborough is farmed by one farmer and owned by a large company. There is a large labour force using big machinery. There is a herd of 296 milking cows.
Narborough trout farm covers 20 acres with over 50,000 fish. The trout are brought in at 4oz and take 18 months to reach 6-7 lbs.
